| Section8 = {{Chembox Related OtherCpds = Dimethyl malonate Malonic acid
  }} }} 'Diethyl malonate', also known as 'DEM', is the diethyl ester of malonic
  acid. It occurs naturally in grapes and strawberries as a colourless liquid
  with an apple-like odour, and is used in perfumes. It is also used to
  synthesize other compounds such as barbiturates, artificial flavourings,
  vitamin B 1, and vitamin B 6.
